medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began approximately 6 months before the current evaluation, noted as small amounts of fresh red blood with defecation. The blood was not mixed with the stool. Two months prior to evaluation, the caliber of his stool decreased.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of prostate cancer treated with brachytherapy, hyperlipidemia, obesity, and multiple actinic keratoses. Previous excision of several cutaneous squamous-cell and basal-cell carcinomas. Normal colonoscopy 3 years earlier. Elevated PSA noted 9 years ago; biopsy confirmed moderately differentiated prostate cancer.
medical_history.family_history: One sister died at 70s of cancer; another sister died at 69 of non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma.
medical_history.social_history: Occasional alcohol consumption, non-smoker, retired, lived alone, previously worked in an office position.
